item.title: Three-Day Rock Trip - Outback Adventure of a Lifetime!
item.description: I had always dreamed of exploring the iconic landmarks of the Australian outback, and so I decided to embark on a three-day road trip from Alice Springs to Kata Tjuta, Uluru, and Kings Canyon.

item.title: Climbing the Most Highest Point of Australia, Gone Wrong!!
item.description: My new roommate, Vinny and I started from Sydney early in the morning only to reach Canberra and then spend like 3 hours shopping in the city.

item.title: How I Travelled during the Pandemic
item.description: It was December 2019 and a start point for so many disasters.

item.title: How I Travelled Solo!
item.description: Most people asked me the same question when I said I’m going on a SOLO Backpacking Trip across the East Coast of Australia: WHY?

item.title: Sea to Summit | Climbing Mount Wellington/kunanyi
item.description: There are not many destinations left from Hobart that I could do and I have already booked the Maria Island shuttle for tomorrow as Masami has been continuously telling me how great it is.

item.title: Sea Kayaking in Byron Bay
item.description: This is the first time I’m going Kayaking.

item.title: Camping in Ben Boyd National Park, Gone Wrong!
item.description: We reached the Saltwater Campground just before the sunset but by the time we set our camp, it’s already dark.

item.title: Why Canberra is my Least Point of Interest!
item.description: Even though just a 3-hour drive away from Sydney, I was never interested in visiting Canberra.

item.title: Sand Boarding in Port Stephens
item.description: We reached Port Stephens at 9 AM but our Sand-boarding slot is at 10 AM, so we have an hour to check out the places in the area.

item.title: Sydney to Melbourne on a Tesla for Free!
item.description: When I say Free I would like to point out that I made the trip on a Tesla Model 3 so I’m only considering the cost of travel and not the car.

item.title: Why I do not photograph everything I see!
item.description: Photography has always been a great interest of mine.

item.title: Why I see Wild & Marine Life only in their Natural Habitats!
item.description: Even though months after arriving in Australia, I never got to see the most hyped animal ‘Kangaroo’ anywhere near where I go.

item.title: Snorkelling in Great Barrier Reef
item.description: The shuttle services would not start before 9 AM and my Great Barrier Reef tour was at 8:30, I started to take the same route as the previous night walking along the Esplanade with so many beautiful views in sight.

item.title: Hiking the Royal National Park
item.description: My roommate and I started from home to Cronulla early in the morning to catch a ferry to Bundeena, the start point of the trek.
